summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 23, 2019. It reports a possible suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein that occurred in the early morning hours of that date, after which he was placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found lying on the floor of his cell in the Special Housing Unit, handcuffed, in what is reported as a possible suicide attempt. He was transported to the HA-Unit and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Possible Suicide Attempt by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., a call for assistance was announced on the Special Housing Unit. Jeffrey Epstein was found lying on the floor of his cell, handcuffed. He was assisted to the HA-Unit on a stretcher, dressed in a suicide smock, and placed on Suicide Watch observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 a.m., a possible suicide attempt involving Jeffrey Epstein occurred at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein was found lying on the floor of his cell in the Special Housing Unit (9-South) while handcuffed.
He was transported via stretcher to the HA-Unit, dressed in a suicide smock, and placed on Suicide Watch observation with staff.
